evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: When the Affordable Care Act (ACA) was enacted in 2010, millions of Americans gained access to affordable, comprehensive health care for the first time.

extracted.value: When the Affordable Care Act (ACA) was enacted in 2010, millions of Americans gained access to affordable, comprehensive health care for the first time.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS), on behalf of the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), has now published a final rule, purportedly pursuant to the ACA, whose effects will be directly contrary to that landmark legislation.

extracted.value: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS), on behalf of the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), has now published a final rule, purportedly pursuant to the ACA, whose effects will be directly contrary to that landmark legislation.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Rather than reducing the cost of insurance for consumers, or increasing their enrollment rates and benefits, Defendants’ new policies will cause at least 1.8 million Americans to lose coverage on the ACA’s health insurance Exchanges in 2026 alone and will ultimately result in higher premiums in the long term and higher out-of-pocket costs for the remaining enrollees.

extracted.value: Rather than reducing the cost of insurance for consumers, or increasing their enrollment rates and benefits, Defendants’ new policies will cause at least 1.8 million Americans to lose coverage on the ACA’s health insurance Exchanges in 2026 alone and will ultimately result in higher premiums in the long term and higher out-of-pocket costs for the remaining enrollees.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The 2025 Rule does not spring from nowhere; rather, it is a clear continuation of the prior Trump Administration’s yearslong effort to undermine the ACA.

extracted.value: The 2025 Rule does not spring from nowhere; rather, it is a clear continuation of the prior Trump Administration’s yearslong effort to undermine the ACA.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Now, the Trump-Vance Administration returns with another “death by a thousand paper cuts” approach to the ACA.

extracted.value: Now, the Trump-Vance Administration returns with another “death by a thousand paper cuts” approach to the ACA.
